response: "I feel like I'm constantly under a microscope, expected to live up to impossible standards."
"I don't even know who I am anymore, trying to be everything everyone else wants me to be."
"It's like I'm chasing this idea of perfection that doesn't even exist, and I'm losing myself in the process."
"I'm starting to question everything about myself, wondering if I'll ever be good enough for anyone."
"I'm exhausted from pretending to have it all together when inside I feel like I'm falling apart."
"I wish I could break free from this pressure to be flawless and just be accepted for who I am."
"I'm overwhelmed by the constant comparison to others and feeling like I'm never doing enough."
"I'm trapped in this cycle of trying to please everyone else, and I'm losing sight of what truly matters to me."
"I'm beginning to realize that the image of perfection society has painted is nothing but an illusion, and it's driving me crazy."
"I just want to scream and let out all this frustration and confusion, but I'm afraid of what people will think of me."
